title: Lele's Ocean Journey
summary: This book tells the story of Lele, a baby turtle living in the ocean of Timor-Leste. It shows how ocean pollution harms sea life and how we can work together to protect the marine world.

texts: In the warm ocean of Timor-Leste, mysterious lives resided.
One day, a small egg wiggled, ready to hatch.
"Hello, world!" A tiny baby turtle, Lele, was born.
Lele bravely stepped towards the sparkling ocean. But strange pieces appeared on the way to the sea.
As Lele grew, the ocean became sadder. Colorful trash began to cover the sea.
"Help me!" Lele was trapped in dangerous trash.
Just then, friends who protect Timor-Leste's ocean appeared and rescued Lele.
"We must all protect our ocean!" They gathered strength and began to clean up the ocean's trash.
Lele healed her wounds and regained health with warm care.
"Hello, ocean!" Lele freely roamed the blue sea with her friends.
Let's all protect our precious ocean like Lele. Reduce plastic waste, and make the ocean clean!

preQuestions.question: What kind of life does Lele live in the ocean?

postQuestions.question: How can we protect our ocean from plastic waste?

missions.title: Protect the Ocean
missions.description: Think of one way to reduce ocean trash and share your idea with your friends.

vocabulary.definition: The act of making the environment dirty or harmful.
Related to the sea and the creatures that live in it.
